wikipedia_page.main:
John Sidney Lockwood (7 December 1920 – 25 April 2013) was an English-born Australian variety entertainer, comedian and actor.
Lockwood worked in radio, theatre, television and film. He became well known for his role in the Australian television soap opera Number 96 playing bumbling Hungarian Jewish deli proprietor Aldo Godolfus from 1972 until 1975. Although Aldo was essentially a comedy character, prior to Number 96, Lockwood had not performed in drama and was primarily a stand-up comic.
